channel.title: Latest PHMSA Hazardous Materials Incident Reports, for OH
channel.description: The latest Form 5800.1 hazardous material reports submitted to the Department of Transportation and posted online by the Pipeline and Hazardous Materials Safety Administration, for OH

  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0

item.title: Report E-2023070009
item.description:
Report E-2023070009

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-20T21:09:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-14
  • City: NORTH CANTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 14, 2023, one (1) 30-gallon drum of UN264 was punctured by a skid steer and released approximately less than one (<1) gallon of product. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted surface. FCE personnel deployed granular absorbents to the released material and worked them in using hand tools. The crew then collected and containerized all impacted material in one (1) 55-gallon drum for disposal.

  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one of the poly 55 gallon drum of guard acid (un1789) had been damaged by a sharp object and had released 15 gallons of product. Contractors were dispatched for the containment and cleanup of the release.

item.title: Report E-2023060795
item.description:
Report E-2023060795

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-20T21:09:15+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-13
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 13, 2023, three (3) 25-pound bags of low temp salt oxidizer were damaged by improper shipper handling and released approximately five (5) pounds of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted surface. TLE personnel deployed granular absorbent pads, degreaser, and hepa vac to the red pigment-impacted trailer interior and collected them. All spent absorbent pads and vac liner were collected and containerized into one (1) 15-gallon drum and one (1) 35-gallon drum for terminal disposal.

item.title: Report E-2023060726
item.description:
Report E-2023060726

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-18T15:09:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-09
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 9, 2023, two (2) 50-pound bags of UN3378 were punctured by a forklift and released approximately seven (7) pounds of product to the trailer floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted surface. Crews utilized a HEPA shop vacuum to collect the free product from the trailer floor. TLE personnel then utilized a degreasing agent with absorbent pads to collect any residual product. Crews restacked and repalletized the product for further processing and shipping. All UN3378 impacted material was collected and containerized in two (2) 35-gallon drums and RLC personnel took possession of the waste to be added to the facility waste stream

item.title: Report E-2023060720
item.description:
Report E-2023060720

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-18T15:09:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-08
  • City: WILMINGTON
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 8, 2023, one (1) 50-pound bag of sodium carbonate peroxyhydrate was damaged due to a faulty skid and released approximately three (3) pounds of product to the trailer interior. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from Thin Line Environmental (TLE) to remediate the impacted surface. TLE personnel downstacked the pallet and removed the one (1) damaged bag from the bottom. Crews utilized a HEPA filtered drum vaccuum unit to remediate the released powder from the pallet, trailer floor, and impacted freight, then used absorbent pads and a degreasing solution on any residual product left behind. TLE personnel patched and plugged the damaged bag, then placed it into one (1) lined 15-gallon poly drum. One (1) lined 35-gallon poly drum of mixed waste and clean up debris was also generated, and both drums were staged in the terminal's waste holding room for further evaluation.

item.title: Report E-2023060718
item.description:
Report E-2023060718

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-18T15:09:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-08
  • City: CLEVELAND
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R&L CARRIERS SHARED SERVICES, L.L.C.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: On June 8, 2023, three (3) 5-gallon pails of paint were damaged and released approximately five (5) gallons of product to the trailer interior, exterior, and parking lot. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from First Call Environmental (FCE) to remediate the impacted surfaces. FCE personnel placed the damaged pails in one (1) 55-gallon overpaclk. The crew then deployed absorbents and worked them in using hand tools, followed by degreasing agent and absorbent wipes. All paint impacted material was collected in one (1) additional 55-gallon drum.

  • Description: SequenceEvent: Package was put up on rollers to be loaded. Package sat on rollers at trailer door for too long and eventually got pushed off by other packages. DescribePack: cap loose/ damaged DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Bagged, contained, spill covered

item.title: Report X-2023061186
item.description:
Report X-2023061186

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-18T15:09:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-06-14
  • City: TWINSBURG
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: Fedex Ground Package System, Inc.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: SequenceEvent: Hazmat was reported damaged in the unload by door 25. Hazmat appeared to be dropped from the IC rollers in the unload. The drum was immediately put in a hazardous materials plastic tote and taken to hazmat cage. DescribePack: The lid of the drum was dented upwards because it fell on side of the lid. DurationRel: 1 and MitigateEffect: Drum was put in a tote to mitigate the effects of the release.

item.title: Report E-2023060684
item.description:
Report E-2023060684

Identified by scraper @ 2023-07-18T15:09:56+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2023-05-31
  • City: COLUMBUS
  • State: OH
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: XPO LOGISTICS FREIGHT, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Description: During off loading it was discovered that the load had shifted during transit and that one case of acetone (un1090) had been damaged by a sharp object and that one of the inner metal one gallon cans had released 1 ounce of product. The warehouse crew was able to contain and cleanup the release, so no contractors were dispatched.
